question: Which war in the African continent is known as the "Africa's First World War"?
explanation: First Congo War, happened from 1996 to 1997, was also known as Africa's First World War. This war's main aim was to overthrow the Mobutu regime of Zaire. This war happened mostly in Zaire (present-day Democratic Republic of Congo) and also spread into Sudan and Uganda. Rwandan Genocide, Corrupt dictatorship of Mobutu Sese Seko, economic decline of Zaire were the causes of this war. This war leads to the renaming of Zaire as the Democratic Republic of Congo.
